The flavor's all that's keeping [Pongify](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pongify) ahead of this on my list of favorite removal spells.

Posted By: Noyan_Dar (5/2/2011 8:06:14 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Finally!
  
Green's only "answers" were normally just having really powerful creatures to out-power opponents' creatures.
  
Wizards gave a few bones in the random form of psuedo-removal or such.
  
Now they threw green a whole flippin' skeleton.
  
Sure, a 3/3 beast is still somewhat of a threat,
  
But in exchange for their combo piece, planeswalker, etc. it's definitely the less of two evils.
posts.html:

Posted By: TheDonMega (5/3/2011 8:07:17 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I dig having a new way to kill planeswalker.. but I don't so much dig giving them a 3/3 beast. Yes, I'll play it, because how many 3 mana answers to a pw are there in standard? However, it's not really card advantage.. you're just choosing between the lesser of 2 evils. Do I give them more creatures.. or let them abuse a planeswalker.. and of course normally you will choose the beasty. Consider though, that they will get the first turn use of their planeswalker to draw cards, make their own beasties, kill something, etc, and then you give them another beast on top of it to kill it. It's kind of like saying, your opponent made you discard, draw a card or etc, and put a beast into play. At that point your opponent is still ahead, just.. without their pw.
  
   
The art and flavor reminds me of the ghost busters movie where they turn into those demon dogs. :)

posts.post_content:
Blue Mage: "I cast Jace, the Mind Sculptor. You don't have Liquimetal Coating so I guess you can't Naturalize that!"  
Green Mage: "That's not Jace, the Mind Sculptor, that's a 3/3 green Beast creature token as far as I'm concerned."  
Blue Mage: "Lolwutno... :("  
  
~~  
  
I like it. In favor of emergency-banning Jace Senior, they just threw in a ton of PW-hate in New Phyrexia. That's my observation at least, I could be totally off though.
